Posts.Content: I looked into SBRT prior to starting my EBRT, probably would have chosen SBRT but my insurance company as with most others will not cover it for prostate cancer. The hospital told me they charge 170k for the treatment, if I paid cash they would do it for 100k.
Posts.Title: Does anyone know how this new Treatment in NJ replaces 42 Radiations with 5 ?

Posts.Content: I have been told by the surgeons and RO’s I have met with that my chances of being “cured” are about the same with either radiation or surgery. Based on my biopsy report (Partin tables) the RO’s feel I have a very good chance I will need radiation following surgery at some point. They feel I should go with the radiation and if there is a reoccurrence there are cryotherapy and Hormone treatments. The surgeons want to remove it and if there is a reoccurrence I can have radiation treatments. If the cancer has moved beyond the prostate bed then neither treatment will be successful. I was pretty sure I would have the surgery but I made the mistake of talking to a RO, it gave me a lot more to think about. PCa is different for everyone and deciding on what treatment is a difficult choice. Good luck in your decision. Age 63, PSA 4.2, T2a , Gleason 7, 9 of 12 malignant, L base 4+3=7 2%, L mid 4+3=7 8%, L apex 3+4=7 4%, R base 3+4=7 30%, R mid 3+4=7 100%, R apex 4+3=7 100% . perineural involvement by tumor, bone scan negative

Posts.Title: Diagnosed 2 days ago.

Posts.Content: I had a bone scan. I was told they would give me the scan and then take some xrays. I understand the bone scan will show if the cancer has moved to the bones. Why do they need xrays? What information do they get from them?
Posts.Title: bone scan?

Posts.Content: It was my understanding that the bone scan was needed to determine if the cancer had spread to my bones. After they did the bone scan they said the xrays were not needed. I am hoping this was good news. I don't meet with the doctor till next Wed. to find out the results of the scan. [QUOTE=HighlanderCFH;172978]Have you posted in another thread in this forum? Trying to remember if you gave us your stats. Can you tell us your biopsy report, along with past & current PSAs, etc? This is my first post on any forum. The only PSA I am aware of was 12/15/12 it was 4.2, thats when the doctor refered me to the Urologist. After the DRE the Doc scheduled the biopsy. Was given the results 2/13 had the scan 2/14. These are numbers off the biopsy report I got today Left base 4+3 2% Left mid 4+3 8% Left apex 3+3 4% Right base 3+4 30% Right mid 3+4 100% Right apex 4+3 100% G Score 4+3=7 PSA: 4.2 T2a-Def.
Posts.Title: bone scan?

Posts.Content: I am 63. I have been reading a lot about prostate cancer and the treatments available. My follow up appointment is with the robotic surgeon at the clinic so I guess that will be their recommendation. I am still pretty confused about the whole situation. I appreciate the information. Keith
Posts.Title: bone scan?
